snippet: Soccer’s international rules board agreed in principle to allow hijabs. A final endorsement is to be made in July.
abstract: Soccer’s international rules board unanimously supports a proposal to reverse a 2007 ban on women from playing in hajibs, or Muslim headscarves, with a final endorsement to come at the board’s meeting in July 2012.
lead_paragraph: Soccer’s international rules board agreed in principle to allow hijabs. A final endorsement is to be made in July.

headline.seo: Women Are Closer to Playing With Headscarves
headline.main: Headscarves for Women’s Games Near Approval
headline.print_headline: Headscarves for Women’s Games Near Approval
